Package etomica.data.histogram

Interface Histogram

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HistogramCollapsing, HistogramDiscrete, HistogramExpanding, HistogramNotSoSimple, HistogramReweightedData, HistogramSimple

    public interface Histogram
    Interface for a class that can tabulate a one-dimensional histogram of data values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addValue​(double x)
      Adds the given value to the Histogram
      long getCount​()
      Returns the number of times the Histogram's addValue method was called.
      double[] getHistogram​()
      Returns the histogram as an array of doubles
      int getNBins​()
      Returns the number of bins in the histogram.
      DoubleRange getXRange​()
      Returns the range of x values (min and max) used in the histogram.
      void reset​()
      resets all histogram values and counts to zero
      void setNBins​(int n)
      Sets the number of bins used by the Histogram.
      void setXRange​(DoubleRange range)
      Sets the range of x values used in the histogram (min and max).
      double[] xValues​()
      Returns the x values from the histogram as an array of doubles

    • Method Detail

      • addValue

        void addValue​(double x)
        Adds the given value to the Histogram

      • getHistogram

        double[] getHistogram​()
        Returns the histogram as an array of doubles

      • xValues

        double[] xValues​()
        Returns the x values from the histogram as an array of doubles

      • getCount

        long getCount​()
        Returns the number of times the Histogram's addValue method was called.

      • setNBins

        void setNBins​(int n)
        Sets the number of bins used by the Histogram. The existing histogram may be dropped or redistributed to the new bins.

      • getNBins

        int getNBins​()
        Returns the number of bins in the histogram.

      • setXRange

        void setXRange​(DoubleRange range)
        Sets the range of x values used in the histogram (min and max). The existing histogram may be dropped or redistributed to the new bins.

      • getXRange

        DoubleRange getXRange​()
        Returns the range of x values (min and max) used in the histogram.

      • reset

        void reset​()
        resets all histogram values and counts to zero
